text: Transforming growth factor-beta suppresses human B lymphocyte Ig production by inhibiting synthesis and the switch from the membrane form to the secreted form of Ig mRNA .
Transforming growth factor-beta ( TGF-beta ) inhibits B cell Ig secretion and reduces B cell membrane Ig expression .

The addition of TGF-beta to human B lymphocyte cultures stimulated with Staphylococcus aureus Cowan strain I and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> completely inhibited B cell Ig secretion ( greater than 90 % ) and decreased B cell surface IgM , IgD , <extra_id_0> kappa L chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> lambda L chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

text: In contrast , TGF-beta had only minimal effects on two other B cell membrane proteins , HLA-DR and <extra_id_0> CD20 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Internal labeling with [ 35S ] methionine and immunoprecipitation with anti-IgM , anti - <extra_id_0> kappa <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and anti - <extra_id_0> lambda <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibodies revealed a striking reduction in <extra_id_0> kappa L chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the presence of TGF-beta .

text: Furthermore , a significant decrease in the switch from the membrane forms of mu and gamma to their respective secreted forms was noted in the presence of TGF-beta .
Nuclear run-on experiments demonstrated decreased transcription of <extra_id_0> kappa L chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: The effects of TGF-beta on two transcriptional regulatory factors , <extra_id_0> Oct-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and nuclear factor ( NF ) kappa B , known to be important in Ig gene transcription were examined .

<extra_id_0> Oct-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels and both <extra_id_0> Oct-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and NF-kappa B proteins in nuclear extracts were not altered by treatment with TGF-beta .
In contrast , levels of the transcriptional factor AP-1 , which is not known to be important in B cell Ig production , were reduced by TGF-beta .

These findings demonstrate that TGF-beta decreases B lymphocyte Ig secretion by inhibiting the synthesis of Ig mRNA and inhibiting the switch from the membrane form to the secreted forms of mu and gamma mRNA .

The mechanism by which TGF-beta inhibits Ig chain synthesis is unclear although it does not involve inhibition of the binding of NF-kappa B or <extra_id_0> Oct-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to their respective target sequences .
